headline: Why Super Micro Computer Stock Surged Today
summary: Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ: SMCI) stock posted big gains in Friday's trading.  The server specialist's share price closed out the day's trading up 10.9% amid gains of 1.2% for the S&P 500 index and 1.7% for the Nasdaq Composite index.  In addition to bullish momentum for the broader market today, Super Micro Computer (also called Supermicro) stock got a big boost from new artificial intelligence (AI) spending guidance from one of the tech industry's biggest players.

In addition to bullish momentum for the broader market today, Super Micro Computer (also called Supermicro) stock got a big boost from new artificial intelligence (AI) spending guidance from one of the tech industry's biggest players.

headline: AI: Why investors need to expand beyond Nvidia
summary: The artificial intelligence (AI) trade is expanding beyond semiconductors and into infrastructure, data centers, software, inference capabilities, and more. Global X assistant vice president and research analyst Tejas Dessai joins Market Domination to discuss the evolving AI landscape. "Over the past couple of years, I think Big Tech has had significant evidence of success when it comes to artificial intelligence," he tells Yahoo Finance. Dessai notes that clear investment value continues to drive growth, benefiting semiconductor leaders like Nvidia (NVDA) and other chip and infrastructure companies. While investment concentration among major companies could eventually slow, Dessai believes this won't happen in 2025. He cites Nvidia's upcoming Blackwell chip, which promises improved efficiency and necessary computing power. "AI infrastructure is maturing," he explains, predicting that current infrastructure investments will shift toward AI inference as use cases develop by 2030. Although Nvidia maintains market leadership, Dessai identifies Broadcom (AVGO), Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), and Marvell (MRVL) as potential market share gainers. "Our advice to investors would be: If Nvidia has worked for you so far, great, but you need to zoom out and focus on the bigger AI infrastructure and data center landscape and really look to get some exposure to that dynamic," he states. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here. This post was written by Angel Smith

headline: Nvidia Stock Climbs Amid Tech Uncertainty. What Could Drive Shares Higher.
summary: Nvidia  stock was rising early Friday, leading the group of Magnificent Seven stocks to start the new year.  Nvidia has so far led the gains of the group of Magnificent Seven stocks that includes  Apple Microsoft Amazon.com Alphabet Meta  and  Tesla  —of which five of them have fallen over the past five trading days, while Meta and Amazon are trading largely flat.  The next big catalyst for Nvidia will likely be CEO Jensen Huang’s speech at the CES tech show in Las Vegas on Monday.

headline: These 5 Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks Make Up 28.8% of the Entire S&P 500 Index
summary: The S&P 500 (SNPINDEX: ^GSPC) is home to 500 companies from 11 different sectors of the economy, making it the most diversified of the major U.S. stock market indexes.  The S&P 500 delivered a return of 25% during 2024, whereas the S&P 500 Equal Weight index, which assigns the same weighting to every stock regardless of its market cap, was up by just 10%.

headline: Tech Stocks Look Overvalued, With 1 Surprising Exception
summary: A new entrant in the Big Tech club of stocks means it’s time for a new name to describe tech’s largest companies.  The new group consists of  Broadcom Apple Tesla Microsoft Meta Platforms Alphabet Amazon  and  Nvidia  All of them carry market values above $1 trillion.  The eight stocks were up by an average of 66% in 2024 versus the S&P 500 index performance of 23%.
